CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, page A17 reads: "The New Calvary - The impressive new Calvary Baptist Church edifice, which was opened for worship recently on Wylie Ave. at Conklin St. stands as mute testimony to eight long years of sacrifice, prayer and perseverance on the part of a comparatively few Calvary faithfuls who were led to triumphant victory through God's grace and with the strategic leadership of the pastor, the Rev. J. A. Cox. Construction at the cost of $250,000, the new sanctuary still bears its badge of triumph. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Calvary Baptist Church with banner that reads "God Has Triumphed, We're Marching In, Sunday, Nov. 9, 1958, All Welcome...", on Wylie Avenue in the Hill District
